00019 /**
00020  * @file   SocketServer.h
00021  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00022  * @date   Mon Jan 25 11:17:58 2010
00023  * 
00024  * @brief  Basic version of a server that will listen for connections on a dedicated
00025  *         socket and then listen on those connections for new messages from clients.
00026  * 
00027  */
00028 #pragma once
00029 #ifndef SOCKETSERVER_H
00030 #define SOCKETSERVER_H
00031 
00032 #include <string>
00033 #include <vector>
00034 #include "util/SocketBase.h"
00035 
00036 /**
00037  * Basic version of a server that will listen for connections on a dedicated
00038  * socket and then listen on those connections for new messages from clients.
00039  */
00040 class SocketServer : public SocketBase {
00041 
00042 public:
00043 
00044   /// Constructor
00045   SocketServer();
00046   /// Destructor, clean up open sockets.
00047   ~SocketServer();
00048 
00049   /** 
00050    * Open a connection to a listening server with a range of possible ports to try.
00051    * 
00052    * @param host - ip address or name of computer to open connection on, often just 127.0.0.1
00053    * @param port - which port  number to start the open connection request with.
00054    *
00055    * This is current coded to allow for 5 trys.  TBD: is this a good number of ports
00056    * Should the caller control the number of trys.
00057    */
00058   unsigned int socketOpen(const std::string &host, unsigned int &startPort);
00059 
00060   /** 
00061    * Open a connection to a listening server.
00062    * 
00063    * @param host - ip address or name of computer to open connection on, often just 127.0.0.1
00064    * @param port - which port to open.
00065    */
00066   bool socketOpen(const std::string &host, const std::string &port);
00067 
00068   /** 
00069    * Try reading from the socket to see if there is anything sent.
00070    * 
00071    * @param messages - data from the socket as delivered by recv()
00072    */
00073   bool  checkForMsgs(std::vector<std::string> &messages);
00074 
00075   /** 
00076    * Try reading from the socket to see if there is anything sent.
00077    */
00078   bool processNewMessages();
00079 
00080   /** 
00081    * Write string to open socket.
00082    * 
00083    * @param msg - Message to write into the socket
00084    */
00085   void sendMsg(const std::string &msg, int type, int channel);
00086 
00087   /** 
00088    * See if any clients have connected to server.
00089    * 
00090    * @return - Number of clients connected in this function
00091    */
00092   bool acceptNewConnection();
00093 
00094   /** 
00095    * Wrapper to get IPv4 or IPv6 as appropriate
00096    * 
00097    * @param sa - Pointer to socket address structure
00098    * 
00099    * @return - Pointer to correct socket address
00100    */
00101   static void *getInAddr(struct sockaddr *sa);
00102 
00103   /** 
00104    * Check to see if the server has any connections yet.
00105    * 
00106    * @return 
00107    */
00108   bool isConnected();
00109 
00110   void cleanUp();
00111 
00112 private:
00113 
00114   int m_ListenSocket;    ///< listening socket descriptor for new connection
00115   int m_RWSocket;        ///< Client socket for reading and writing
00116   std::string m_Port;    ///< Port open for new connections. ///< Address information for socket connections
00117 
00118 
00119 };
00120 
00121 #endif /* SOCKETSERVER_H */
